hints.content:
The area is the number of $1 \times 1$ squares the shape covers.

 Let's count the number of squares covered in each shape to find which shape has an area of $13$ square centimeters.

[[☃ image 1]]

This shape has an area of $12$ square centimeters, not $13$ square centimeters.

options.alt:
A shape with 8 sides is made up of 12 squares drawn inside a grid. The length of each side is as follows, starting from the top in a clockwise pattern, 2 squares to the right, 1 square down, 1 square to the left, 4 squares down, 1 square to the right, 3 squares down, 2 squares to the left, 8 squares up.

Each square inside the shape is counted from 1 to 12. !

hints.content:
[[☃ image 1]]

This shape has an area of $14$ square centimeters, not $13$ square centimeters.

options.alt:
A shape with 4 sides made of 14 squares drawn inside a grid. The length of each side is as follows, starting from the top in a clockwise pattern, 7 squares to the right, 2 squares down, 7 squares to the left, 2 squares up.

Each square inside the shape is counted from 1 to 14. !

hints.content:
[[☃ image 1]]

This shape has an area of $13$ square centimeters.

options.alt:
A shape with 10 sides made of 13 squares inside a grid. The length of each side is as follows, starting from the top in a clockwise pattern, 3 squares to the right, 2 squares down, 2 squares to the left, 1 square down, 2 squares to the right, 1 square down, 4 squares to the left, 3 squares up, 1 square to the right, 1 square up.

Each square inside the shape is counted from 1 to 13. !

question.content:
**Which shape below has an area of $13$ square centimeters?**

[[☃ image 1]]

 is $1$ square centimeter.

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A square is equal to 1 square centimeter. !
